class compare_it.diff.CiscoHierarchy(f, indention, sect_pfx)

Bases: dict

Convert Cisco Normal Configuration to a Hierarchical model

add_line_to_dict(line)

adds line to self dictionary

Args:

line (str): config line

property config
descent_block(line_indention, line)

Descented from indention occur

Args:

line_indention (int): indention of line line (str): line string

exceptional_lines_maps(line)

Some of Cisco commands are not following standard hierarchy or indention those are defined here. such lines will be identified and returned with modified line currently identified non-standard indentions are as below exc_maps = { ‘ auto qos ‘: ‘auto qos ‘,}

Args:

line (str): input line

Returns:

str: modified line per map

indented_block(line_indention, line)

process of indented block ahead

Args:

line_indention (int): indention of line line (str): line string

mask_passwords(line)

Masking of passwords on line valid pw characters defined are: {” password “, ” key “, ” secret “, ” authentication-key “}

Args:

line (str): config line

Returns:

str: updated line after masking pw if any

remarked_lines(line)

checks if line is a remark or not and return boolean accordingly.

Args:

line (str): config line

Returns:

bool: if remark line, else previos line

section_conf(test=False)

section configuration to be serialzed

Args:

test (bool, optional): for test purpose only. Defaults to False.

trailing_remarks_update(line)

Some of cisco config contains trailing remoarks, such remarks will be removed before processing.

Args:

line (str): line string

Returns:

str: updated line after removing remark

class compare_it.diff.CompareText(file1, file2, change_type='')

Bases: object

Class to start comparing for two configs readfiles-> convert to lists, -> detects device/config tpyes, -> run appropriate comparetext object. change_type: str: either add/del (+, -)

compare_it.diff.get_string_diffs(difference_dict, hn='', difference_dict_labels=None)

converts dictionary to string representation

Args:

difference_dict (dict): nested dictionary hn (str, optional): hostname for heading if any. Defaults to “”. difference_dict_labels (dict, optional): top level key labels if want to print. Defaults to None.

Returns:

str: string representation of nested dictionary
